message.content: Yes, the authors specify the training details in the paper and the appendices. They provide information about the hyperparameters selection procedure (Appendix E.2), the selection methodology for the environments in the benchmark (Appendix E.1), the experimental procedure and benchmarking procedure (Section 3 in the main paper, Appendix E.3, and E.4), and details on the computational resources used for the experiments (Appendix E.3).

Yes, the authors describe the experimental procedure, hyperparameter selection, and benchmark environments selection in detail. They provide information on the total number of time steps, maximum training time, and their relationship to the agent and MDP. Furthermore, they explain the methodology to generate a diverse set of MDPs and the procedure to select agent hyperparameters using random search optimization. These details can be found both in the main paper and in Appendix E.

Yes, the authors specify all the training details in the provided sections. They describe the selection methodology for the environments in the benchmark, explain the benchmarking procedure, detail the hyperparameter selection process, and outline the computational resources used for the experiments. The authors also provide information on the MDP families and scenarios in their experiment section and the appendix. The hyperparameters for the agents are obtained by random search optimization with the objective of minimizing the cumulative regret across a set of randomly sampled environments. The training time, maximum number of total time steps, and number of seeds are also mentioned.
